interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: America: Imagine a World without Her
Review Date: 2014/11/21
Store: John Sullivan  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
Product Description: ["The new film from the creators of 2016: OBAMA'S AMERICA takes America's critics at face value and imagines a world in which she never existed. Today that notion of the essential goodness of America is under attack, replaced by another story in which theft and plunder are seen as the defining features of American history--from the theft of Native American and Mexican lands and the exploitation of African labor to a contemporary foreign policy said to be based on stealing oil and a capitalist system that robs people of their 'fair share.' Gerald Molen, the Academy Award-winning producer of SCHINDLER'S LIST, Dinesh D'Souza, the New York Times best-selling author and creator of 2016, and director John Sullivan invite you on a journey of discovery that will bring you face-to-face with America's most compelling contemporary critics along with the heroes who built America, in the times in which they lived, bled, and sacrificed in order to build a great nation. You'll be there as Christopher C"]
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '082401', 'Director': 'John Sullivan', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 28, 2014', 'Producers': 'Gerald Molen', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Important video and TRUTH for our time.  Makes ya proud.
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
America: Imagine a World without Her
John Sullivan  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, All Lionsgate Titles
["The new film from the creators of 2016: OBAMA'S AMERICA takes America's critics at face value and imagines a world in which she never existed. Today that notion of the essential goodness of America is under attack, replaced by another story in which theft and plunder are seen as the defining features of American history--from the theft of Native American and Mexican lands and the exploitation of African labor to a contemporary foreign policy said to be based on stealing oil and a capitalist system that robs people of their 'fair share.' Gerald Molen, the Academy Award-winning producer of SCHINDLER'S LIST, Dinesh D'Souza, the New York Times best-selling author and creator of 2016, and director John Sullivan invite you on a journey of discovery that will bring you face-to-face with America's most compelling contemporary critics along with the heroes who built America, in the times in which they lived, bled, and sacrificed in order to build a great nation. You'll be there as Christopher C"]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Consumption Preferences:** Enjoys documentaries and films that provoke thought and challenge mainstream narratives, particularly on American history and identity.
  
- **Values:** Shows a strong appreciation for patriotic themes and perspectives that highlight American virtues, suggesting a preference for content that emphasizes national pride and a counter-narrative to criticism of America.
  
- **Review Behavior:** Tends to provide high ratings (5.0) for content that resonates with personal beliefs, indicating a tendency to endorse films that align with their views.
  
- **Engagement Style:** Expresses enthusiasm for content, as evidenced by positive and affirming language in reviews (e.g., "Important video and TRUTH for our time. Makes ya proud.")

- **Interest in Historical Contexts:** Demonstrates an interest in exploring historical events and figures, particularly through a lens that defends or reinterprets American history.

Overall, this user appears engaged with content that aligns with a patriotic viewpoint and seeks to challenge critical perceptions of the United States, emphasizing positive narratives and individual sacrifice throughout history.
